title: Sara’s Sesame String Beans
ingredients: - 1 pound string beans, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces (4 cups)
- 1 tablespoon toasted sesame seeds, crushed in a mortar and pestle
- 1 teaspoon agave syrup or maple syrup
directions: 1. Set up a large bowl of ice water.
2. In a large pot of generously salted boiling water, cook the string beans for 15 to 30 seconds, just until they lose their raw edge.
3. Transfer the beans to the ice water to cool, then drain and pat them very dry with a clean kitchen towel.
4. In a medium mixing bowl, stir together the crushed sesame seeds, soy sauce, tahini, agave, and 1 teaspoon salt until smooth.
5. Add the cooled beans to the dressing and toss well to coat.
6. Season with additional salt if needed.
7. Serve immediately or store in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 1 week.
